result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.
result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Ryan J. Porodish

records.addlTxt:
Defendant Ryan J. Porodish not in court.  Attorney James Patrick McLinden appeared by video for Ryan J. Porodish.  Prosecuting attorney Anthony A. Lambrecht appeared by video for the State of Wisconsin. 
Defendant failed to appear for plea date.
Bench warrant authorized.  Defendant to be remanded into custody in order to take care of this warrant.
DEFENDANT IS TO BE REMANDED TO THE JAIL. DEFENDANT IS TO BE DENIED BY PUBLIC DEFENDER FOR SPECIAL BAIL APPEARANCE. DEFENDANT MUST REPORT IMMEDIATELY TO THE JAIL FOR BOOKING.
Status hearing on October 18, 2022 at 02:30 pm.
Scheduling conference on September 7, 2022 at 10:00 am.

records.descr: Demand for Discovery and Inspection - Defendant

records.addlTxt:
Defendant waives his right to a preliminary hearing.   Defendant is bound over to Circuit Court Branch 2 for further proceedings.   
ARRAIGNMENT 
Information filed.   Not guilty plea.   Jury Calendar.   Offer deadline is set for 06-24-22 at 8:30 a.m.   Scheduling conference is set for 07-13-22 at 9:45 a.m.   
Minutes.

2:19 pm - Prosecuting attorney Gail Ann Prost in court for the State of Wisconsin.  Defendant Ryan J. Porodish appeared by video, in custody. Attorney Luke Harrison in court for defendant.  More time needed to appoint counsel in this matter.
Initial appearance scheduled for May 16, 2022 at 01:30 pm.
Response from Judge Dietz to defendant.
Re:  Felony bail jumping as repeater, on 03-21-22.
Order to report to MTPD for photo and prints

BAIL HEARING - 
Defendant in custody and appearing by video from the Manitowoc County Jail.  The State informs the Court that the defendant will be charged with the crime of felony bail jumping.  The matter is continued for initial appearance on 04-18-22 at 1:30 p.m.  Bail is set at $1,000.00 recognizance bond with the conditions that he report to the Manitowoc City Police Department for fingerprints, photographs and identifying information within 48 hours or, if incarcerated, within 72 hours of release.  Bail furnished and defendant is released from custody.
Minutes.
